title: Commerce Secretary Lutnick Maintains $600 Million Tether Stake Despite DOJ Investigation

description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick refuses to recuse from Trump's Digital Asset Working Group despite maintaining $600 million stake in Tether, cryptocurrency under DOJ investigation for money laundering and sanctions evasion. His firm Cantor Fitzgerald recently settled $6.75 million SEC fraud charges. Lutnick's family continues benefiting through Bitcoin investments after his nominal divestiture to sons.

sources.title: Lutnick's $600 Million Tether Conflict at Commerce
Commerce Secretary's Tether stake under scrutiny

notes: Lutnick's massive Tether stake represents one of the largest financial conflicts in cabinet history. Tether, the world's largest stablecoin, faces DOJ investigation for facilitating money laundering, terrorism financing, and sanctions evasion. As Commerce Secretary overseeing trade and technology policy while serving on the Digital Asset Working Group, Lutnick can directly influence cryptocurrency regulation benefiting his $600 million position. His refusal to recuse demonstrates open defiance of ethics norms.
